intro: Anthospermum esterhuysenianum var. esterhuysenianum, commonly known as the Esterhuysen's anthospermum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces white or pale yellow flowers that bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
